page.title: 02NEW AND OLD SOUTH CERNEY
page.content: Many people interviewed could not remember South Cerney as it was 15 years ago, which suggests a relatively new community. However, residents do not want the village to grow any more and lose its village atmosphere. There are a large number of new houses, on estates, which people have moved into within the last 5 to 10 years. Many people suggested that they would move away if the village were allowed to grow into a town. The best elements of the village are thought to be the older parts such as the picturesque Cotswold stone houses, the church, the tree_ lined Silver St. and the village bridge. Quaint street names within the village include Bow Wow, Upper Up and The Langet.
